It is native to the island of Socotra, located in the Arabian Sea, where it thrives in arid and rocky environments. This plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss. Calonema dimidium produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue or white, adding a delicate touch to its desert habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
